snippet: When a man approached Walter Scott’s family with the video, what might have been another shooting of a black man by the police suddenly became an astonishing glimpse of life and death.
abstract: Video shot by bystander Feidin Santana conclusively disproves Police Officer Michael T Slager's version of events leading to his shooting death of Walter L Scott in North Charleston, SC; Slager, who is white, had claimed Scott, who was black, physically threatened him, but video clearly shows Slager chasing a running Scott and shooting him five times in the back; Slager has been charged with murder and has since been fired.

byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES and ALAN BLINDER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ben Rothenberg from North Charleston, Marc Santora from New York, Manny Fernandez from Houston, and Matt Apuzzo and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. Susan C. Beachy contributed research from New York, and Kitty Bennett from St. Petersburg, Fla.

lead_paragraph: When a man approached Walter Scott’s family with the video, what might have been another shooting of a black man by the police suddenly became an astonishing glimpse of life and death.

headline.main: Seeing Path to Justice in Video of Shooting on Bystander’s Phone
headline.print_headline: A Stark Image of a Shooting Carries Impact
